verses.verse: "Very truly, I say to you, the one who does not enter the sheep fold through the door but climbs in some where else is a thief and a robber.
"But the one who enters through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
"The doorkeeper opens for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
"As soon as he puts his own sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him and know his voice.
"They will not follow a stranger but will run away from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers."
Jesus gave them this illustration, but they didn't understand what was told to them.
Then Jesus said to them, "Very truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
"All who ever came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn't listen to them.
"I am the door. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved, will go in and out, and find pasture.
"The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they might have life and that they might have it more abundantly.
"I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives his life for the sheep.
"But the hireling, who is not a shepherd, whose sheep are not his own, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and runs away. The wolf seizes them and scatters the sheep.
"The hireling runs away, because he is a hireling and isn't concerned about the sheep.
"I am the good shepherd and know my own and am known by my own [sheep].
"Just as the Father knows me, even so I know the Father, and I lay down my life for the sheep.
"I have other sheep, which are not of this sheep fold I must also bring them; they will hear my voice, and there will be one flock and one shepherd.
"My Father loves me because of this, for I lay down my life, so that I might take it again.
"No one takes it from me; I lay it down on my own. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father."
Again there was a division among the Jews because of these sayings.
Many said about him, "He has a demon," and, "He is insane; why listen to him?"
Others said, "These are not words from a demon possessed man. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?"
Now in Jerusalem the Feast of Dedication began; it was winter,
and Jesus was walking in the Temple on Solomon's Porch.
Then the Jews surrounded him and said to him, "How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, plainly tell us."
Jesus answered them, "I told you, and you didn't believe. The works that I do in my Father's name bear witness of me,
but you do not believe, because you are not my sheep, just like I said to you.
"My sheep hear my voice. I know them, and they follow me.
"I give eternal life to them. They will not perish, ever, or will any one pluck them out of my hand.
"My Father, who gave [them] to me, is greater than all, and no one is able to pluck [them] out of the hand of my Father.
"The Father and I are one."
Therefore the Jews again picked up rocks to stone him.
Jesus started speaking to them, "I have shown you many good works from my Father, for which one of those works are you stoning me?"
The Jews answered, saying, "We are not going to stone you because of a good deed, but because of blasphemy, and because that you, being human, make yourself God."
Jesus answered them, "Isn't it written in your law: I said, «You are gods?»
"If he called them "gods" to whom the Word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken,
how can you say about him whom the Father has set apart for himself and sent into the world, «You blaspheme,» when I said, «I am the Son of God?»
"If I don't do the works of my Father, don't believe me,
but if I do, even if you don't believe me, believe the works, so that you may know and believe that the Father [is] in me and I in him."
Then they tried again to seize him, but he escaped out of their hand, [40] and went again across the Jordan to the place where John first baptized and stayed there.
Many came to him and said, "Even John didn't do a miracle, but everything that John said about this man is true."
And many believed in him there.
